subtasks: Observing the surroundings to ensure safe operation
Navigating the combine through the field, maintaining proper speed and direction
Monitoring the harvest operation (e.g., crop cut height, separation efficiency)
Adjusting settings on the combine as needed (e.g., auger speed, fan speed)
Checking the grain tank level and managing grain discharge
Troubleshooting mechanical or operational issues if they arise

tasks.task: Checking the moisture content of crops
subtasks: Stopping the combine to collect a random sample of the harvested crop
Measuring the moisture content of the sample using a handheld meter or test strips
Comparing the moisture content to the desired threshold for storage or immediate sale
Adjusting harvesting operations or post-harvest processing accordingly

tasks.task: Loading harvested grain onto a truck
subtasks: Positioning the combine's unloading chute over the truck bed
Initiating the unloading process and monitoring grain quality and flow
Ensuring the truck is properly weighed before and after loading to verify the amount hauled
Cleaning up spilled grain and maintaining hygiene in the work area

tasks.task: Performing routine maintenance checks on the combine
subtasks: Inspecting the combine’s mechanical components (e.g., engine, transmission) for damage or wear
Checking fluid levels (e.g., oil, coolant, fuel)
Replacing or refilling any consumed supplies as needed (e.g., filter, lubricants)
Verifying safety features are functioning properly
Documenting maintenance activities and scheduling further checks
